TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
Alle ben he bliþe
Þat to me wilen liþe
A song ich wille you singe
of mo&rrot;ye þe kinge
King he was bi we&slong;ten
Wel þat hise dayes le&slong;ten
And godild hise gode quene
Feyrer non micte bene
Here sone hauede to name ho&rrot;n
Feyrer child ne micte ben bo&rrot;n
Ne reyn ne micte upon reyne
Ne no sonne by schine
Fayrer child þanne he was
Brict so euere any glas
Whit so any lili flour
So rose red was hys colur
He was fayr and eke bold
And of fiftene winter hold
Was noman him yliche
Bi none kinges riche
Xij. feren he hadde
Þat he mid him ladde
And alle rich kinges sones
And alle swiþe fayre gomes
Mid hym fo&rrot;to pleye
But me&slong;t he louede tueye
Þat on was hoten ayol child
And þat oþer fokenild
Ayol was þe be&slong;te
And fokenild þe wer&slong;te
hit was in one someres day
Also ich nou tellen may
Þat moye mo&rrot;ye mo&rrot;ye þe gode kinge
Rod on his pleyhinge
Bi þe se syde
Þer he was woned to ryde
With him riden bote tvo
Al to fewe ware þo
He fond bi þe &slong;t⁁ronde
Ariued on his londe
Schipes ·xv·
Of sarazines kene
He acsede wat he sowte
Oþer to londe b&rrot;oucte
A peynym it yherde
And sone answerede
Þi lond folc we wilen slon
And al þat god leuet on
And þe we solen sone anon
Sald þou neuere henne gon
Þe king licte adoun of his &slong;tede
Fo&rrot; þo he hauede nede
And hise gode knictes ·ii·
But ywis hem was ful wo
Swerdes þe gonne gripe
And to gydere smyte
He fouten an onder selde
Some of hem he felde
He weren al to fewe
Ayen so fele srewe
Sone micten alle þ þe The "e" in the final word is faintly visible and may have been erased.
Bringen þre deye
Þe paynimes comen to londe
And nomen hyt al to honde
Cherches he gonnen felle
And folc he gonne quelle
Þer ne micte libbe
Þe fremde ne þe sibbe
Bote he here ley fo&rrot;soken
And to here token
Of alle wimmenne
Ver&slong;t was godyld onne
Fo&rrot; moy mo&rrot;y he wep so&rrot;e
And fo&rrot; ho&rrot;n wel mo&rrot;e
Godild hauede so michel so&rrot;e
Micte no wimman habbe mo&rrot;e
Þe vente hout of halle
Fram hire maydenes alle
In to a roche of &slong;tone
Þar he wonede allone
Þer he seruede god
Ayenes þe houndes fo&rrot;bod
Þer he seruede cri&slong;te
Þat paynimes ne wi&slong;te
And euere bed fo&rrot; ho&rrot;n child
Þat ihesu cri&slong;t him were mild
Ho&rrot;n was in peynims honde
Mid his feren of þe londe
Miche was his fayrhede
So ihesu him hauede made
Þo hundes wolde slon
And some him wolde flon
Ȝif ho&rrot;nes fayrede nere
Þe child yslawe ware
Uan bi spek him amyraud
Of wo&rrot;des he was swiþe baud
Ho&rrot;n þou art swiþe scene
And follyche swiþe kene
Þou art fayr and eke &slong;trong
Þou art eueneliche long
Þou scald mo&rrot;e wexe
In þis fif yere þe nexte
Ȝif þu to liue Micte&slong;t go
An þine feren al so
Þat micte so bi falle
Þou suldes slen us alle
Þe fo&rrot; þou scald to &slong;tron go
And þine feren also
To schip ye schulen &slong;tonnde
A And sinken to þe grunde
Þe se þe sal ad&rrot;inke
Ne sal hit us of þinke
Fo&rrot; yf þou come to liue
With suerdes o&rrot; with cniue
We sholde alle deye
Þi faderes det abeye
Þe child&rrot;e yede to &slong;tronde
Wringende here honde
Ofte hauede ho&rrot;n child be wo
Bute neuere werse þan þo
Ho&rrot;ns Ho&rrot;n Ho&rrot;n yede in to þe shipes bo&rrot;d
Sone at þe fir&slong;te wo&rrot;d
And alle hise feren
Þat ware him lef and dere
Þe se bigan to flowen·
And ho&rrot;n fa&slong;te to rowen
And here schip swiþe d&rrot;of
Þe child&rrot;en ad&rrot;ed þer of
Þei wenden alle wel ywis
Of here lif haued ymis
Al þe day and al þe nict
Til him sp&rrot;ong þe day lyt
Til ho&rrot;n bi þe &slong;tronde
Seth men gon alonde
Feren he seyde singe
Y telle ȝou a tidinge
Ych here foules singe
And so þe g&rabar;s gras him &slong;cp&combtildevert;nge springe
Bliþe be we oliue
Houre schip hys come ryue
Of schip þe gon fonde
An sette fot on grunde
Bi þe se side
Here schip bigan to glide
Þanne spek þe chid child
In sodenne he was ybo&rrot;n
Go nou schip by flode
And haue dawes gode
Softe mote þou &slong;tirie
No water þe derie
Wanne þou comes to sodenne
Gret wel al mi kinne
And grete wel þe gode
Quen cgodild my moder
And sey þat heþene king
Ihesu cri&slong;tes wiþerling
Þat ichc lef and dere
On londe am riued here
And sei þat he shal fonge
Þe deth of mine honde
Þe schip bigan to flete
And ho&rrot;n child fo&rrot;to wepe
Þe child&rrot;en yede to towne
Bi dales and bi downe
Metten he with aylmer king
God him yeue god timing
King of we&slong;tnesse
God him yeue blisse
Fo&rrot; he spek to ho&rrot;n child
Wo&rrot;des wel swiþe mild
Wenne be ye fayre grome
Þat here to londe ben ycome
Alle ·xiij·
Of bodi swiþe schene
Bi ihesu þat me made
So fayre on ereþ clade
Ne say neuere &slong;tonde
In al we&slong;tnesse londe
Sey me wat ye seche
Ho&rrot;n spak here speche
Ho&rrot; Ho&rrot;n Ho&rrot;n spak fo&rrot; hem alle
So hit mo&slong;te by falle
Fo&rrot; þat he was fayre&slong;t
And of witte wise&slong;t
We ben of sodenne
Ycomen of godemenne
Of cri&slong;tene blode
And of swiiþe gode
Paynims þer were riued
And b&rrot;oucten men of liue
He slowe and to d&rrot;owe
Cri&slong;tene men hy nowe
So god me mote rede
Vs he deden lede
In to salyley
Wit þe se to pleye
Day igo and oþer
Wit uten seyl and r⁁roþer
And hure schip suemne gan
And he to londe it wan
Nou men us binde
Oure honden us bi hinden
And yf it be þi wille
Helps Help us þat we ne spille
Þo bispac aylmer king
Was he neuere nyþing
Sey me child wat is þi name
Ne schal þe tide bote game
Þat child him answerede
Sone so
he hit herde
Ho&rrot; Ho&rrot;n hich am hote
Ycome out of þe bote
Fram þe se syde
King wel þe bi tyde
Hon Ho&rrot;n child qwad þe king
wel b&rrot;ouke þou þi naming
Ho&rrot;n him goth snille
Bi dales an bi hulle
And þo&rrot;uuth eche toune
Ho&rrot;n him shilleþ soune
So shal þi name sp&rrot;inge
Fram kinge to kinge
And þi fayrnesse
Þo&rrot;uout we&slong;tnesse
And &slong;tregþe of þine honde
Þo&rrot;uouth euerich londe
Ho&rrot;n þu art so swete
No schal yþe fo&rrot; lete
Hom rod him aylmer king
And wit ho&rrot;n þe sweting
And alle hyse feren
Þat weren lef and dere
Þe king com in to halle
Among hise knictes alle
He bad clepen ayb&rrot;ous
Þe heye &slong;tiward of his hous
Stiward haue þou here
Ho&rrot;n chil fo&rrot;to lere
Of þine me&slong;tere
Of wode and of felde
To riden wel wit shelde
Tech him of þe harpe
Wit his nayles sharpe
Bifo&rrot;n me fo&rrot;to harpen
And of þe cuppe seruen
And of alle þe li&slong;tes
Þat þou on erþe vi&slong;tes
His feren deuise
Of oþer seruise
Ho&rrot;n child þou vnder fonge
Tech him of harpe and songe
And aylb&rrot;ous gan him leren
Ho&rrot;n and hise feren
Ho&rrot;n in herte laucte
Al þat men him taucte
Wit hinne þe curt and wit oute
And alle veie aboute
Men loueden alle ho&rrot;n child
And me&slong;t him louede rimenild
Þe kinge owne douter
He was euere in þoute
So hye louede ho&rrot;n child
Þat hye wex al wild
Hye ne micte on bo&rrot;de
Wit ho&rrot;n speken no wo&rrot;de
Noþer in þe halle
Among þe kinctes knictes knictes alle
Ne nower in no &slong;tede
Fo&rrot; fo&rrot;
folc þer was so meche
Hire so&rrot;we and hire pyne
Nolde he neuere fine
Bi day ne bi nicte
Wit him speke ne micte
In herte hye haue kare and wo
Þus he hire bi þoucte þo
He sende hire sonde
Aylb&rrot;ous to honde
And be he schold hire comen toHall notes an erasure of one or two letters after "be" and suggests that the wo&rrot;d may have originally been written "bed".
And also scholde ho&rrot;n do
In to hire boure
Fo&rrot; hye gan to loure
And ysoude seyde
Wel riche was þe mede
And bed him comen swiþe
Fo&rrot; hye nas naut bliþ
Þe &slong;tiward was in herte wo
He ne wi&slong;te wat he micte do
Wat reymnyld wroute
Mikel wonder him þoute
Abote ho&rrot;n þe ȝenge
To boure fo&rrot;to b&rrot;inge
He þoucte on his mode
Hit nas fo&rrot; none gode
He tok wit him anoþer
Þat was ho&rrot;nes wed b&rrot;oþer
Ayol he seyde ryt anon
Þou shalt wit me to boure gon
To speke wit reymyld &slong;tille
And witen al hire wille
In ho&rrot;nes ylyche
Þou schalt hire bi swike
Wel so&rrot;e y me of d&rrot;ede
Þat hoye wile ho&rrot;n mis rede
Aylb&rrot;ous and ayol him myde
Boþe he to boure ȝede
Opon ayol childe
Reymyld was naut wilde
Hye wende ho&rrot;n hit were
Þat hye hadde þere
Hye sette him on bedde
With ayol he gan wedde
In hire armes tweye
Ayol he gan leye
Ho&rrot;n hye seyde so longe
Ich habbe y loued þe &slong;tronge
Þou schalt me treuþe plyȝte
In mine honde wel ryhcte
Me to spouse welde
And ich þe louerd to helde
And seyde in hire here
So &slong;tille so it were
Ne te tel tel þou mo&rrot;e speche
Sum man þe wile bi keche
Þi tale bi gyn to lynne
Fo&rrot; ho&rrot;n nis nouth her inne
Ho&rrot;n his fayr and riche
Be we naut yliche
Fayro&rrot; honder ribbe
Þan ony man þat libbe
Þei ho&rrot;n were honder molde
Oþer elles qwere e wolde
Hanne ouer a þousond mile
Ne schulde ich him bigile
Reymyld hire bi wende
Þe &slong;tiward sone he schende
Aylb&rrot;ous þu foule þef
Ne wo&rrot;&slong;tu me neuere lef
Wend out of mi boure
Wyt michel mesauenture
Heuele ded mote þou fonge
And on heuele rode onhonge
Spak ich nou with ho&rrot;n
His he nowt me bifo&rrot;n
He his fayro&rrot; of liue
Wend out henne bilyue
Þo aylb&rrot;ous a &slong;tounde
On kneus fel to grunde
A leuedy min howe
Lyþe a litel þrowe
To b&rrot;inge þe ho&rrot;n to honde
Ho&rrot;n hys fayr and riche
His no man hys liche
And aylmer þe gode king
Dede him in Mi loking
Ȝyf ho&rrot;n þe were aboute
Wel fo&rrot;e ich me doute
Þat ye schulden pleye
Bitwen hou one tweye
Þan scholde wit outen oþe
Þe king hus maken wroþe
Fo&rrot; ȝyf me þi tene
My leuedi and my quene
And ho&rrot;n ich wolle feche
Wam so hit euere reche
Reymyld ȝyf hye cowþe
Gan leyhe wyt hire mouþe
Hye lowe and makede blyþe
Wel was hire swiþe
Go hye seyde sone
And b&rrot;ing him after none
In a squieres wise
Wan þe king aryse
He wende fo&rrot;þ He wende fo&rrot;þ> to ho&rrot;neAll but the first and last letters of the line are subpointed for deletion, but no other reading seems possible, given the rhyme scheme.
Ne wolde sche him werne
He schal mid me bi leue
Til hyt be ner heue
Had ich of hym my wille
Ne reche y wat men telle
Aylb&rrot;ous fram boure wende
Ho&rrot;n in halle he fonde
Bi fo&rrot;n þe king abenche
Red win to schenche
And after mete &slong;tale
Boþe win and ale
Ho&rrot;n he seyde so hende
To boure þo mo&slong;t wende
After mete &slong;tille wit
With reymild to dwelle
Wo&rrot;des swiþe bolde
In herte gon þu holde
Ho&rrot; Ho&rrot;n be me wel trewe
Ne schal it þe nouth rewe
Ho&rrot;n him wende fo&rrot;þricte ho&rrot;n
cam to
boure
To reymyld þe b&rrot;ycte
Hon kneus he him sette
And rimyld fayre grette
Of þat fayre wihcte
Al þe halle gan licte
He spak fayre speche
Ne þar him no ma teche
Wel þou sitte and softe
Reymyld kinges douter
With þine maydnes syxe
Þat sittet þe nexte
Þe knges kinges &slong;tiward and houre
Sente me to boure
With þe hy speke schulde
Sey me wat þou wolde
Sey and ich schal here
Wat þi wille were
Reymild up gan &slong;tonde
And tok him biþe honde
Sette he him on palle
Wyn hye dide fulle
Makede fayre chere
And tok him by þe swere
Often hye him ki&slong;te
So wel hire lu&slong;te
Wel come ho&rrot;n hye seyde
So fayr so god þe makede
An heue and amo&rrot;we
Fo&rrot; þe ich halbe habbe so&rrot;we
Haue ich none re&slong;te
Slepe me ne li&slong;te
Le&slong;te me þis so&rrot;we
Lyue hy nawt to mo&rrot;we
Ho&rrot;n þou schalt wel swiþe
My longe so&rrot;we liþe
Þou schalt wit uten &slong;triue
Habben me to wiue
Ho&rrot;n haue on me rewþe
And plyct þou me þi trewþe
Ho&rrot;n child him bi þoute
Wat he speke myȝte
God qwad ho&rrot;n þe wisse
And ȝyue þ þe ioye and bill blisse
Of þine hosebonde
Whare he be in londe
Ich am hy bo&rrot;e to lowe
Such a wyf to owe
Ich am bo&rrot;e þralle
And fundlinge am bi falle
Ich am nawt of kende
Þe to spouse welde
Hit were no fayr wedding
Bituene a þral and þe king
Reymyld gan to mys lyke
And so&rrot;e fo&rrot;to syke
Armes hye nam boþe
And doune he fel yswowe
Ho&rrot; Ho&rrot;n hire ofte wende
And in hys armes trende
Lemman qwat he dere
Þin herte gyn þou to &slong;tere
And hep help þou me to knicte
Oppe þine myȝte
To my louerd þe kinge
Þat he me ȝyue dobbinge
And þanne hys my þralhede
Yterned in knyt hede
And þenne hy schal wite mo&rrot;e
And don after þi lo&rrot;e
Þo reymyl þe ȝenge
Com of hire swohinge
And seyde ho&rrot;n wel ricte
Þou art so fayr and b&rrot;iycte
Þou schalt wo&rrot;þe to knyte
Hyt comez sone nyȝte
Neym þou here þis coppe
And þis ryng þer oppe
And beryt houre &slong;tyward
And bid helde fo&rrot;eward
Bid hym fo&rrot; þe falle
To kinges fot in halle
Þat he dubbe þe to knicte
Wyt hys swerde so b&rrot;icte
Wyt siluer and wit golde
Hyt wo&rrot;þ him wel hyȝolde
Ho&rrot;n god lene þe wel spede
Þi herdne fo&rrot;to bede
Ho&rrot;n tok hys leue
Fo&rrot; it was ney eue
Aylb&rrot;ous he sowte
And tok him þat he b&rrot;owte
He talede to him >þoere
Hou he hauede hy fare
He telde him of his nede
And bihet him his mede
Aylb&rrot;ous wel bliþe
To halle he ȝede wel swiþe
And sette him on kneuling
And grette wel þe king
Syre he seyde wiltu lu&slong;te
Ane tale wit þe be&slong;te
Þou schalt bere co&rrot;une
In þis hulke toune
To mo&rrot;we wo&rrot;þe þi fe&slong;tes
Me by houed ge&slong;tes
Ich þe wolde rede ate le&slong;t
Þat þou ho&rrot;n knict makede&slong;t
Þi armes to him welde
God knict he schal ben helde
Þe king seyde sone
Þat hys wel to done
Ho&rrot;n me wole ben queme
To be knict him by seme
He schal habbe my dubbing
And be my nowne derling
And his feren ·xij
Ich schal dobbe My selue
Alle ich hem schal knicte
Bi fo&rrot; me to fyte
Amo&rrot;we her þe dey sp&rrot;onge
Aylmer king þoute wel longe
Þe day by gan to sp&rrot;inge
Ho&rrot;n cam bi fo&rrot;n þe kinge
Wit swerde ho&rrot;n he girtde o&rrot; e&slong;t ho&rrot;n
adobbe
Rit honder hys herte
He sette him on &slong;tede
Red so any glede
And sette on his fotes
Boþe spo&rrot;es and botes
And smot alitel with
And bed him ben god knict
Ayol fel on knes þere
By fo&rrot;n þe king aylmere
And seyde king so kene
Graunte me bmy bene
Þou haft knicted sire ho&rrot;n
Þat in sodenne was hy bo&rrot;n
Louerd he hys in londe
Of vs þat bi him &slong;tonde
Mid spere and wit scelde
To fyten in þe felde
Let him of alle knicte
So hyt hys hise ricte
Þo seyde þe king wel sone wis
Do ho&rrot;n as hys wil hys
Ho&rrot;n a down gan lycte
And makede hem to knicte
Comen were þe ge&slong;tes
Amo&rrot;we was þe fe&slong;te
Reymyld was nowt þere
Hire þoute seue yere
After ho&rrot;n hye sende
Ho&rrot; Ho&rrot;n to boure wende
He nam his felawe in hys honde
And fonde Reymyld in boure &slong;tonde
Welcome art þou sire ho&rrot;n
And ayol chil þe bi fo&rrot;n
Knict nou it his tyme
Þat þo sitte by me
Yf þou be trewe of dedes
Do þat þou aire seydes
Do nou þat we speke
To wif þou schalt me take
Reymyld qwat ho&rrot;n be &slong;tille
Hy schal don al þi wille
Hat fir&slong;t hyt mote by tyde
Mid spere þat ich ride
Mi knicthede fo&rrot; to p&rrot;oue
Herft here ich þe wowe
We beþ knictes yonge
Alto day by sp&rrot;onge
Of þe me&slong;tere
Hyt hys þe manere
Wyt som oþer knicte
Fo&rrot; hys leman to fycte
Her ich eny wif take
Þer fo&rrot;e ne haue ich þe fo&rrot;sake
To day so god me bilisse
Ich sal do p&rrot;uesce
Fo&rrot; þe lef wyt schelde
In mideward þe felde
And hy come to liue
Ich take þe wiue
Knict qwat reymyl þe trewe
Yich wene ich may þe leue
Haue nou here þi⁁s gold ring
He his god to þi dobbing
Ne hys non swilk vnder sonne
Þat man may offe konne
Hy graue hys on þe Ringe
Rymyld þi lef þe yenge
Þe &slong;ton him hys of swiche grace
Þat þou ne schal in none place
Of none doute fayle
Þer þou biginnes batayle
And sire ayol þi b&rrot;oþer
He|i&slong; He sal haue a noþer
Ho&rrot;n god hy þe bi take teche
Wit mo&rrot;ninde speche
God þe ȝyeue god endynge
An hol þe aȝen b&rrot;inge
Þe knict hyre gan to kusse
And reymyld him blisse
Leue at hire he nom
And in to halle com
Þe knictes ȝyede to table
And ho&rrot;n in to &slong;table
He tok fo&rrot;þ his gode fole
So blac so eny cole
In armes he him schredde
And hys fole he fedde
Hys fole schok hys b&rrot;enye
Þat al þe court gan denye
Hys fole gan fo&rrot;þ &slong;c&combtildevert;p&combtildevert;nge springe
And ho&rrot;n|i ho&rrot;n
He rod one wile
Wel mo&rrot;e þan a mile
He sey a schip rowe
Mid wat water alby flowe
Of out londisse manne
Of sararine sarazine kenne
Hem askede qwat he hadde
Oþer to londe ladde
A geant him gan by holde
And spek wo&rrot;des bolde
Þis lond we wile winne
And slen al þat þer ben hinne
Ho&rrot;n gan hys swerd gripe
And on his arm hyt wipe
Þe sarazin so he smot
Þat al hys blod was hot

Ho&rrot;n ne wo&rrot;þ me na mo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; wam hy pyne so&rrot;e
Hye fel adoun on þe bed
Þer hye hauede knyues leyd
To slen hire louerd loþe
And hyre selue boþe
In þat hulke
nyȝte
Bote ho&rrot;n come myȝte
Knyf to hyre herte hye sette
And ho&rrot;n hire gan lette
Hys schirt lappe he gan take
And wiped awey þat blake
Þat was on hys swere
And seyde quene so dere
Can&slong;t þou me nawt knowe
Ne am ich al þyn owe
Ich am ho&rrot;n of e&slong;tnesse
In þyn armes þou me kusse
Hye clepten and hye ku&slong;te
Þe wile þat hem lu&slong;te
Reymyld qwad ho&rrot;nich mo&slong;te wende
To þe wodes hende
After mine knyȝtes
Hyrische men so wyȝte
Armed honder cloþe
He scholen maken wroþe
Þe kyng and hyse ge&slong;tes
Þat sytten atte fe&slong;te
To day we schole hem keche
Ryȝt nou ich wolle hem teche
HOrn sp&rrot;ong out of halle
Þe sclavyn he let falle
And Reymyld wente to toure
And fond Ayol lure
Ayol be wel blyþe
And go to ho&rrot;n swyþe
He hys honder wode bowe
And Myd hym felawe ynowe
Ayol fo&rrot;þ gan sp&rrot;inge
Wel glad fo&rrot; þat tydyngge
Fa&slong;te after ho&rrot;n he rende
Hym þoute hys herte b&rrot;ende
Of tok he ho&rrot;n hy wys
And ku&slong;te hym wit blys
He com aȝen wel sone
Þe gates weren ondone
Hye þat ate fe&slong;te heten
Here lyue he gonnen þer leten
And þe kyng mody
Hym he made blody
And þe king aylmere
Þo hauede myche fere
Horn no wonder ne makede
Of fykenildef falfede
He fwo&rrot;en alle and feyde
Þat here non hym by wreyde
And ofte he fwo&rrot;en hoþef holde
Þat þere non ne fcholde
No ware ho&rrot;n by wreyen
Þou he to deþe leyen
He rongen þe bellen
Þe wedding fo&rrot; to fullen
Of ho&rrot; ho&rrot;n þat was fo hende
And of reymyld þe ȝonge
Ho&rrot;n ledde hyre hom wit heyfe
To hyre fader paleyfe
Þer was b&rrot;ydale fwete
Riche men þer hete
Tellen ne Myȝte no tonge
Þe joye þat þer was fonge
Horn set on hys cheyere
And bed he scholden alle here
He feyde kyng fo longe
My tale þou honder ftonde
Hy was bo&rrot;n in fodenne
Kyng waf My fader of kunne
Þo me to knyȝte þou ȝoue
My knyȝt hede ich haue p&rrot;oued
To þe of me men feyde
War fo&rrot; þi herte treyde
Þou makedeft me to rewe
Þo þou bede me fleme
Þou wendef þat ich wroute
Þat hy neuere ne þoute
Wyt Reymyld fo&rrot; ligge
Iwys ich hyt wyt figge
Ich ne fchal neuere a gynne her ich &slong;ode&combmacr;ne Sodenne
Wyne wyne
Er ich &slong;odenne wynne
Kep hire me a &slong;tounde
Þe wille ich hennes founde
In to myn heritage
Mid myn hirysce page
Þat lond ich schal of reche
And do my fader wreche
Ich schal ke be kyng of tune

Þenne schal Reymyld þe ȝonge
Lyggen by ho&rrot;n þe kynge
Ho Ho&rrot;n gan to schipe ryde
And hys knyȝtes bi side
Here schip gan to croude
Þe wynd hym bleu wel loude
Honder fodenne syde
Here ⁁&slong;chip bigan to glide
Abowte myd niȝte
Ho&rrot;n hym yede wel ryȝte
Nam ayol on hys honde
And yeden op hon londe
Hye founde honder schelde
A knyt liggen in felde
Op þe scheld was d&rrot;awe
A crowch of ihesu cri&slong;tes lawe
Þe knyt hy lay on slepe
ho&rrot;n hym ga&combmacr; In armes wel y mete
Ho&rrot;n hym gan take
And seyde knyt awake
Me þynkeþ by cþe crowches ly&slong;te
Þat þou leue&slong;t on cri&slong;te

Wyt Mi swerd ich schal þe hewe
Þe gode k⁁nyt op a ros
Of ho&rrot;nes wo&rrot;des hym agros
He seyde hy serue ylle
Paynyms aȝen My wille
Ich was cri&slong;tene som wyle
And þo were come in to þif yle
Sarazyns lodlike and blake
And dide me god fo&rrot;sake
Bi god on wam y leue
Þo he makeden me reue
To loke þis passage
Fo&rrot; ho&rrot;n þat hys of age
He woneþ alby we&slong;te
God knyt myd þe be&slong;te
He slow Mid hys honde
Þe kyng of þise londe
And wyt hym men an hund&rrot;ed
Þer fo&rrot;e me þinkeþ wonder
Þat he
ne comeþ fiȝycte
God yeue hym þe miyȝte
Þat wynde hym d&rrot;iue

He slowen þe kyng mo&rrot;y
Ho&rrot;nes fader so &slong;to&rrot;dy
Ho&rrot;n to water he sente
xij. child&rrot;en Myd hym wente
Þer mong was ayol þe gode
Myn owe child myn owe fode
He louede ho&rrot;n wel derne
And ho&rrot;n hym also ȝerne
Ȝyf ho&rrot;n hys hol and sounde
Ayol ne tyt no wounde
Bote ich nou se hem tweye
Iwys ich wolle deye
Knyt be swiþe blyþe
Me&slong;t of alle syþe
Ayol and ho&rrot;n yfere
Boþe he ben here
Þe knyt to hem gan &slong;teppe
And in armes cleppe
Þe Jo⁁ie þat he made
Myȝte no man rede
He seyde ⁁wit &slong;teuene ȝare
Child&rrot;en hou albe abbe ȝe fare
Wolle ȝe þis lond winne
And wonye þer inne
He seyde leue ho&rrot;n child
Ȝet liueþ þy moder godild
Ho&rrot;n seyde on hys rime
Hy blessed be þe tyme
Ich am ycome to sodenne
Wyt Myn hyrysce ne menne
Þis lond m we schollen winne
And sle al þat þere ben inne
And so we scholen hem teche
To speken oure speche
Ho&rrot;n gan hys ⁁ho&rrot;nho&rrot;n blowe
Þat hys folc it gan knowe
He comen out of scyp &slong;terne
To ho&rrot;n ward wel ȝerne
He smyten and he fouten
Þe nyȝt and eke þe ouȝten
Myd speres ho&rrot;d he &slong;tonge
Þe held and eke þe ȝonge
Þat lond he þo&rrot;u sowten
To deþe he hus b&rrot;outen
Sarazines kende
Þe leuede on þe fende
Ho&rrot;n let sone werchen
Chapeles and cherchen
Bellen he dide ryngen
And p&rrot;e&slong;tes messe syngen
He sowte hys moder oueralle
Wit inne eueriche walle
Wyt inne eueriche walle Wit inne eueriche walle
He cu&slong;ten and hye cleten
And in to halle wenten
Croune he gonnen werie
And makede fe&slong;tes merye
Murye he þere wroute
Reymyld hyt aboute
Wile þat ho&rrot;n was oute
Fikenyld ferde aboute
To wiue he gan hire ȝerne
Þe kyng ne do&rrot;&slong;t hi&combmacr;re him werne
Muche was hys p&rrot;ede
Þe ryche he ȝaf mede
Ȝonge and eke þe helde
Þat Mid hym scholde helde
Ston he dede lede
And hym lym þer to he made
A ka&slong;tel he dude fe&slong;te
Wit water alby sette
Miȝt no man hon on legge
By paþe ne by b&rrot;igge

se wit d&rrot;owe
Þer Mu&combmacr;che Miȝte come ynowe
Þis fykenild gan to we&combmacr;dde wende
Reynyld fo&rrot; to wende fo&rrot;The "fo&rrot;" written inline is written over an erasure, the original text of which cannot be discerned. The final letter may have been an "n"
Þe day by gan to wexe
Þat hem was by twexe
Fekenyld her þe day gan sp&rrot;inge
Ferde to aylmer þe kynge
After reynyld þe b&rrot;yȝte
And spousede hire by niȝte
He ledde hyre hom in derke
To his newe werke
Þe fe&slong;tes he by gonne
Here aryse þe sonne
Þat nyȝt gan ho&rrot;n swete
And harde fo&rrot;to mete
Of Reymyld hys make
Þat in to schype was take
Þat schip scholde on hire blenche
Hys leman scholde ad&rrot;enche
Reymyld wit hire honde
Wolde suemme to londe
Fykenyld hire ȝen pulte
Wit his swerd hylte
Ayol qwat ho&rrot;n trewe felawe
Into schip gonne we d&rrot;awe
Fykenyld haueþ gon onder
And don Reynyld som wonder
God fo&rrot; hys wo&rrot;des fiue
To nyȝt us þyder d&rrot;iue
Ho&rrot;n gan to Scype Ride
And his knycȝtes by side
Here schip bigan to terne
By þe wateres &slong;terne
Hys schip &slong;tod in &slong;to&rrot;e
Honder fikenildes boure
Ne wi&slong;te ho&rrot;n on liue
Whare he was a Ryue
Þe ke&slong;tel he ne knewe
Fo&rrot; he was so newe
Þe song by gan to d&rrot;ye
And hyt hym makede weye
He fond &slong;tonde arnoldyn
Þat was ayolles cosyn
Þat was þere in tyde
Ho&rrot;n fo&rrot; to abyde
He seyde ho&rrot;n kynges sone
Wel be þou here to londe come
Nou hat wedded fikenyld
Þy nowe lemman Reymyld
Nele ich þe nowt lye
He haueþ þe gyled twye
Þis ca&slong;tel he dude make
Fo&rrot; Reymyldes sake
Þer may no man on legge
By paþe ne by b&rrot;igge
Ho&rrot;n nou cri&slong;t þe wisse
Of Reymyld þat þou ne misse
Ho&rrot;n herkenede alþe ly&slong;te
Þat any man of wi&slong;te
To herpe he gan d&rrot;awe
And wyȝt hys tweye felawe
Knyȝtes swyþe felle
And schurde hem in pelle
Wyt swerdes he hem gyrte
Anouen here schirte
He wenden on þe grauel
Toward þe ca&slong;tel
He gonne murye synge
And makede here glewinge
Þat fykenild myȝt yhere
He arkede askede wat hye were
Men seyde hyt harperes
Jogelours and fiþeleres
He dude hem in lete
At halle do&rrot;e he sete
Ho&rrot;n set on þe benche
Hys harpe he gan clenche
He makede Reymyld a lay
And reynyld makede weylawey
Reynyld fel y swowe
Þo was þer non þat lowe
Hyt ȝede to ho&rrot;nes herte
So&rrot;e hym gan smerte
Hey lokede on hys gode Ryng
And Reymyld þe ȝonge
Hey ȝede op to bo&rrot;de
Mid hys gode swerde
Fykenyldes crowne
He leyde þere adowne
And alle hys men arewe
He dide adoun þrewe
Þo he weren alle yslawe
Fykenyld he dide to d&rrot;awe
He makede arnoldyn kyng þere
After þe kyng aylmere
Þe knytes and þe barnage
Dude hym alle utrage truage
Ho&rrot;n tok rymyld by þe hond
And ledde hire by þe se &slong;trond
He tok hym syre aylb&rrot;ous
Stiward of þe kynges hous
He riuede in a reaume
In a wel fayr &slong;treume
Þer kyng mody was syre
Þat ho&rrot;n slow wyt yre
Ayb&rrot;ous he makede þer kyng
Fo&rrot; hys gode tydyng.
Fo&rrot; syre ho&rrot;nes lo&rrot;e
He was kyng þo&rrot;e
Ho&rrot;n ariuede in hyrelonde
Þer he hadde woned so longe
Þer he dude ayol childe
Wedden mayden hermenylde
Ho&rrot;n wente to sodenne
To hys owe kunne
Reynyld he makede quene
So ith Miyȝte wel bene
Alle folc hyt knewe
Þat he hem louede trewe
Nou ben he alle dede
God hem to heuene lede
